qas.question: Whose visions led to the identification of the House of the Virgin Mary?
Which disciple is known as "the Disciple whom Jesus loved?"
With whom is it believed that Mary lived with in Ephesus?
In which century was the House of the Virgin Mary found?

plausible_answers.text: a house near Ephesus in Turkey

qas.question: Where did Anne Catherine Emmerich live?
Where did Irenaeus and Eusebius of Caesarea live?
In what century did Anne Catherine Emmerich meet Irenaeus?
In what century did Mary live in Ephesus with John?
What Evangelist did Anne Catherine Emmerich meet in Turkey?

context: In <b7_0><b8_0>the <a4_0>19th<a4_0/> century<b8_0/><b7_0/>, <b5_0>a house near Ephesus in <a0_0>Turkey<b5_0/><a0_0/> was found, based on the visions of <a1_0>Anne Catherine Emmerich<a1_0/>, an Augustinian nun in Germany. It has since been visited as the House of the Virgin Mary by Roman Catholic pilgrims who consider it the place where Mary lived until her assumption. The Gospel of John states that Mary went to live with the Disciple whom Jesus loved,[Jn 19:27] identified as <a2_0><b9_0>John the Evangelist<b9_0/><a2_0/>.[citation needed] Irenaeus and Eusebius of Caesarea wrote in their histories that John later went to Ephesus, which may provide the basis for the early belief that Mary also lived <b6_0>in Ephesus with <a3_0>John<b6_0/><a3_0/>.
